title: UN Passes Resolution for Palestinian State, Gaza Division Amid Objections
snippets: UNSC backs US plan, approving a stabilisation force and ‘board of peace’ to oversee Gaza’s governance and rebuilding.
Measure mandates transitional administration for Gaza and floats 'credible pathway' for Palestinian statehood.

The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.
Included in the 20-point peace plan is the establishment of an International Stabilisation Force (ISF), which would work to demilitarise the territory.
The UN Security Council has voted to adopt a resolution endorsing US President Donald Trump's plan to end the war in Gaza. The proposal authorizes an international stabilization force. DW has more.
UN Security Council approves Trump plan for Gaza security force Axios
UN Security Council adopts US resolution on Trump's Gaza plan Reuters

The resolution, which includes references to an independent Palestine, was passed by a vote of 13-0 with China and Russia abstaining The UN security council has endorsed proposals put forward by Donald Trump for a lasting peace in Gaza, including the deployment of an international stabilisation forc
The U.S. had pushed the U.N. Security Council to support and enshrine Trump’s 20-point Gaza peace plan. Israel, Hamas, Russia and others had raised objections.

Russia and China abstained in the vote, which provides a legal mandate for the Trump administration’s vision of how to move past the cease-fire to rebuild the war-ravaged enclave after two years of war.

The UN Security Council on Monday approved a U.S. plan for Gaza that authorizes an international stabilization force to provide security in the devastated territory and envisions a possible future path to an independent Palestinian state.
titles: UN Security Council approves US resolution backing Trump’s Gaza plan
UN Security Council passes US resolution backing international Gaza force
The U.N. Security Council approves a U.S. plan for a Gaza stabilization force
Trump's plan for Gaza backed by UN Security Council
Middle East: UN Security Council approves Trump's Gaza plan
UN Security Council approves Trump plan for Gaza security force - Axios
UN Security Council adopts US resolution on Trump's Gaza plan - Reuters
UN security council votes to endorse Donald Trump’s Gaza plan
U.N. Security Council approves Trump’s 20-point peace plan for Gaza
U.N. Security Council Adopts Trump’s Peace Plan for Gaza
UN approves U.S. plan authorizing an international stabilization force in Gaza
summary: The UN Security Council passed a resolution, including plans for a future Palestinian state and the division of Gaza into a "green zone" for reconstruction and a "red zone" in ruins. The U.S. supports this resolution as part of Trump's Gaza peace plan, despite objections from Israel, Hamas, and others. Russia and China abstained from the vote, which aims to rebuild Gaza after two years of conflict.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful insights into the ongoing issues surrounding the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. It reports on a potential solution proposed by the UN and gives readers a deeper understanding of the geopolitical dynamics involved. However, it doesn't provide enough context or details about the impacts and potential consequences of the resolution.

Former U.S. treasury secretary Larry Summers said on Monday he will step back from all public commitments, days after President Donald Trump ordered the Justice Department to investigate his and other prominent Democrats' ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

summary: Former U.S. Treasury Secretary and Harvard professor Larry Summers announced he will reduce his public engagements after emails with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein were disclosed by a House committee. Summers expressed shame over the correspondence and intends to step back to "rebuild trust," though he will continue teaching at Harvard. The revelation has sparked calls, including from Senator Elizabeth Warren, for Harvard to cut ties with Summers.
